meanings.definition: Either of the two external openings of the nasal cavity in vertebrates that admit air to the lungs and smells to the olfactory nerves.
meanings.sent1: The horse flared its nostrils as it took in a deep breath.
meanings.sent2: She could smell the flowers through her nostrils.
meanings.sent3: The nostrils of the dog twitched comically when it caught a whiff of bacon.
meanings.sent4: The nostrils of the forest seemed to breathe in unison with the wind.
meanings.sent5: His flaring nostrils made him look like an angry bull ready to charge.
